inclusion.criterion: Carotid artery stenosis caused by atherosclerotic plaque
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Diagnosed with severe atherosclerotic carotid stenosis according to a previously described method (North American Symptomatic Carotid Endarterectomy Trial Collaborators, 1991)
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: Severe carotid artery stenosis confirmed by transcranial Doppler and carotid duplex ultrasonography
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Provision of informed consent regarding trial procedure
inclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: Carotid artery stenosis caused by fibromuscular dysplasia, Takayasu's arteritis or radiation injury
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: Severe central nervous system disorders, such as complete loss of cerebral function on the affected side with cerebral paralysis
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: Life expectancy <2 years because of intracranial tumors or other diseases
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: Renal impairment (if use of contrast agent will worsen renal function)
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: Concurrent hemorrhagic disease, or contraindication to antiplatelet or anticoagulant therapies for safety reasons
exclusion.label: not_met

notes: Patient has carotid artery stenosis caused by atherosclerotic plaque and severe carotid artery stenosis confirmed by transcranial Doppler and carotid duplex ultrasonography. However, the patient's life expectancy is not explicitly stated.
